properties.areaDesc: Oakland; Lapeer; Sanilac; Shiawassee; Livingston; Genesee
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 9 at 2:59PM EST until January 12 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Detroit/Pontiac MI
properties.description:
* WHAT...Freezing rain producing ice accumulations around half an
inch possible. Sleet and snow may mix in at times, mainly north
of I-69, but just light accumulations if at all. Winds could
gust as high as 40 mph, which may further increase later Sunday
morning.

* WHERE...Sanilac, Shiawassee, Genesee, Lapeer, Livingston and
Oakland Counties.

* WHEN...From late Friday night through Sunday morning.

* IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the
ice and strong winds. Travel could become nearly impossible.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures are expected to fall below
freezing late Friday night into Saturday morning. Uncertainty
exists whether temperatures will reach and drop below 30
degrees, which would then allow ice to accumulate on roads and
may make for treacherous travel. Otherwise, ice accumulation
may be confined to elevated surfaces, such as tree tops and
power lines. Prepare for the possibility of extended power
outages and avoid travel if possible.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING
